reviews.text: We are expatriate residents living in Oman. My daughter recently wanted a 'beach birthday party' and we decided to try the Oman dive center. After a few emails back and forth between the admin staff and myself we finally devised a suitable party package that suited us. I use the term package very loosely as this place obviously is not used to hosting childrens birthday party functions and the communication back and forth by email was a little frustrating. However, we continued to persue this option and also decided that after the birthday party we would like to stay the night. Usually there is a minimum of 4 nights but the staff here were able to accommodate our request and we reserved 3 huts/rooms for 1 night only.
reviews.title: We didn't want to leave!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The party began and I was somewhat surprised by how well EVERYTHING went. The manager was superb and all the staff were so friendly and willing to help. We could not have asked for a better venue. The food was delicious and did I mention the service.....??? We were well taken care of. Everyone at the birthday party thoroughly enjoyed it and some are recommending this place as a venue to all their friends.
reviews.title: Perfect for a short diving trip
oman dive center - diving experience
reviews.text: The' icing on the cake' was the fact that we stayed here the night as well. After all the guests left, we relaxed outside our quaint accommodation while the kids continued to enjoy frolicking in the beautiful, picturesque surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Included in our stay was buffet breakfast and dinner. Both of these meals were of a reasonably high standard. We enjoyed our trip here so much that we did not want to leave!!!! We will definately be back, infact my husband is hoping to return in a few weeks with the kids and his father for another enjoyable, relaxing time!!
reviews.title: Bad service? Not here!

reviews.text: Thank You to the staff of Oman Dive Center - in particular Conny, you made our girls birthday party a very special, memorable occassion and we are sure you will have more customers because of it!!!
reviews.title: Worst food, good vacation, bad employees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities: amazing. Long private beach, beautiful bay with calm warm water, good size swimming pool, lovely restaurant and bar. Its idyllic.
reviews.title: Paradise. Stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accommodation: for me - perfect. Simple huts actually on the beach, with air con! The bathroom is large and half-outside (but don't worry its private), so it was amazing to shower looking out at the deep blue sky / stars!
reviews.title: step out of your hut into the Indian Ocean

reviews.text: Food. Actually very very nice. The accommodation price includes breakfast and evening meal, which I do not normally like, especially a buffet which this was. However, they have a different theme each night (BBQ, Indian, steak night, etc) and every night the food was excellent.
reviews.title: Very Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: very helpful and lovely staff, but this is not a place dictated by service.
reviews.title: Very nice and peaceful

reviews.text: Location: about 20 minutes drive from Muscat (or about US$10).
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: This place is fun for a day at the beach but you have to pay to get in. Regardless if you only want to eat at the restaurant or spend the whole day there.
reviews.title: Great place - but get rid of the arrogant and disinterested staff

reviews.text: The staff (I think they are mainly German or something like that) are extremely arrogant. They refused to let us bring in food for our kids who have a life threatening food allergy. Even when we showed them the medication we had brought for them,. When I told them they were discriminating against people with an allergy and that I would have loved to have my kids eat in their restaurant instead of having to bring their own food, they just shrugged their shoulders and were very disinterested.
reviews.title: Dreadful

reviews.text: The food at the restaurant fills a hungry tummy but is nothing special.
reviews.title: Arrogant Staff, unclean, food was awful

reviews.text: The setting of the place is lovely and there's lots of fish to be seen in the water.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The staff at the gate are arrogant, ignorant, rude and unwelcoming, which is a great shame as the location and setting of this resort are both fantastic. I'm afraid I will not be back - who would want to be abused by people whom you are paying (and paying well) to provide you with hospitality? I found my experience particularly disappointing when one considers the warm and genuine hospitality that one normally associates with Oman. The ODC management needs to wake-up or be replaced.
reviews.title: fantastic family dive experience

reviews.text: The place itself is in a nice location, albeit a bit too far from the town (and from alternative restaurants). Beach is ok but one has to be mindful of the fact that during the low tide (from around 2 pm till the evening), one has to walk about 200 m to get to the water (the problem then is that there are boats there too, so it is difficult really to enjoy the water). We thought the price was a bit on a high side with about 300 USD for a family of four (including a 4y old child); even if you factor in breakfast (basic) and dinner (ok).
reviews.title: If you have deep enough sleep, it is ok place...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bungalows were nice, although a bit too close to each other (we could hear the snoring of our neighbor). But snoring, as it turned out, was not the main problem we had... the stray dogs were barking much louder and longer. They messed up two of our three nights, barking a good part of these nights (about 20 ft from our bungalow). After the first sleepless night we obviously complained to the shift manager and she promised to take a swift actions. Nothing happened (although the dogs were constantly around during the day). Fortunately enough, the dogs kept silent. But the third night was a nightmare; the entire neighborhood of guest wake at 2 am, trying to figure out what to do with the dogs. We called the security who said that this was not the first time the dogs were around and told us that it was usually police who took care of stray dogs. So it was not just the phenomena of these nights.
reviews.title: Great Location and facilities - although too many short-cuts

reviews.text: We then simply decided to leave the place one night earlier to get a decent sleep in another hotel. While we were packing later in the evening, we still saw the dogs around, as our neighbors (who kept complaining to the management) were already in anticipation of another crazy night...
reviews.title: This is heaven! Please don't tell other people...

reviews.text: In general, our impression was that the place is catering more for divers and snorkelers than for their overnight guests. And as one of the reviewers here was surprised about the service-related complaints, one should perhaps keep in mind that the true quality of services usually manifests itself during challenging situations.
reviews.title: Excellent spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Oman Dive Centre is beautifully situated in a quiet cove. The beach is generally divided into two; one part for the day-trippers and the other for the hotel guests, in this way, hotel guests have lots of space on the beach and do not have to stay in the often crowded 'public part'. We stayed in a lovely barasti hut with comfy beds and a private outdoor bathroom - it was lovely to take a shower in the outdoor! However, the huts are generally tightly packed and guests may therefore be easily be disturbed by eachother. While the lunches at the Resort's restaurant were excellent, the breakfast and dinner buffés which were included in the room rate were nothing but a disappointment! There was no possibility of ordering à la carte, instead you had no other choice but to eat the buffé, which was mediocre at its best. We got the impression that the owners indeed had a vision and a sympathetic idea about how to run this place, but that these ideas actually were lost in translation and too many short-cuts were taken in almost every extent of running the Centre. Our stay was over the New Years Holiday, and we were forewarned that there would be a 'small party' at the Centre (mind you, it only has about 20-30 huts) and that we would have to pay extra for food and the party. When New Years Eve finally came, this 'small party' had suddenly emerged into a huge occassion with hundreds of paying guests and a hired dj who played dance music for hours on end on the beach a few hundred meters from the barasti huts. Although hotel guests were invited to attend (or rather, had no choice but to pay for this event), we found very few guests actually attending this noisy event and most guests, including us, felt disturbed rather than content about attending these festivities....
reviews.title: Very relaxing
